oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The role of public, non governmental and private actors for the development of organic farming: the Italian successful example.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Santucci, Fabio M.
Antonelli, Annarita
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
Policy environments and social economy
Italy
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The authors analyse the growth of organic agro-food sector in Italy and explain the relationships between private operators, NGOs and various levels of governance (municipalities, regions, central government), which have been acting (in various forms) for the development of organic agriculture and food processing / distribution.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Santucci, Fabio M. and Antonelli, Annarita (2004) The role of public, non governmental and private actors for the development of organic farming: the Italian successful example. NEW MEDIT, III (2), pp. 42-49.
